hanzi-su-wiki:
書

Значения

Писать; бумаги, книги

Мнемоника

  • Рука с кистью или стилетом 聿, наносящая письмена 二. Писать при свете дня 日. По иной версии — фиксировать на письме то, что сказал рот с языком.

  • "Я пишу кистью иероглиф 'солнце' 日."

Варианты

书

heisig_chinese_memo: Make sure you practice writeing kanji in your book with a brush every day before the sun goes down.
heisig_constituent: write, brush, tongue wagging, sun, day
heisig_story: The sage talks rapidly with his tongue wagging in his mouth, while the brush of the scribe runs apace to write down the master 'swords.
koohiiStory1: Make sure you practice writing kanji with a brush every day before the sun goes down.
koohiiStory2: The calligrapher had a peculiar habit: when using her brush to write, she would stick out her tongue, just slightly.
jp_example_words:
書き取り(かきとり): dictation
書き取る(かきとる): to write down, to take dictation, to take notes
箇条書き(かじょうがき): itemized form, itemization
願書(がんしょ): written application or petition
原書(げんしょ): original document
書評(しょひょう): book review
聖書(せいしょ): Bible, scriptures
著書(ちょしょ): literary work, book
秘書(ひしょ): (private) secretary
文書(ぶんしょ): document, writing, letter, note, records, archives
書留(かきとめ): writing down, putting on record
教科書(きょうかしょ): text book
下書き(したがき): rough copy, draft
書斎(しょさい): study
書籍(しょせき): book, publication
書店(しょてん): bookstore
書道(しょどう): calligraphy
書物(しょもつ): books
書類(しょるい): documents, official papers
清書(せいしょ): clean copy
投書(とうしょ): letter to the editor, letter from a reader, contribution
読書(どくしょ): reading
図書(としょ): books
書く(かく): write
辞書(じしょ): dictionary, lexicon
図書館(としょかん): library
葉書(はがき): postcard
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Why would you try to take a brush to the sun? It's almost too obvious, because you want to write something down.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Just imagine yourself sitting on the sun, writing back to your friends and family with a brush. For someone who can visit the sun, it's really weird that you are writing with a brush like this, but you're doing it just the same.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: What did you write about? You were writing about this amazing circus show (しょ)you just watched on the sun. You didn't expect there to be any shows here, but turns out you were wrong!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Think of your favorite live shows and imagine them on the sun. Also imagine yourself writing back to your friends and family about said shows.
Ru_trainchinese: shū: (сущ/глаг) книга; стиль каллиграфии; документ; письмо; писать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: with the brush (聿) in the sun (日) you write
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A simple old man always carries a book around with him.  Other than that he has a key, a walking stick, and clothes hangers at home.
origin_of_ch_char_book: Woman writing with a brush pen (18th–19th century) In modern China, this is the character that is used to signify reading a book: (書, 书, shu, book) On the top there is a hand, and underneath the character is the bottom of the tree (本, ben, root). Like the stump of a tree, a person holds a long, stubby pen tool. Below is a fire (火, huo, fire) burning for the ancestral rite, and a mouth that means words at the rite. This character describes someone recording the words of various people performing at the memorial service. It is now used to mean a book. (論, 论, lun, essay; discuss) The left symbolizes a forthright statement like a spear (言, yan, speak). Upper right corner is a roof or lid that collects something in it. And there are wood pieces with various records tied up together . The ancients have written a lot of records on bamboo sticks, and they discuss together whether these records are right or wrong. Therefore, this character has become to mean logical theory or a rational discussion.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription means document, chanting: "Yin's received (grant) Wang Ling (order) book". It is also used as the name of a person, Luan Shufang: "The descendants of Luan Shu are treasures for all generations."

"Shuowen": "Books, chopsticks. From the sound of the people." Duan Yucai's note: "Chopsticks are called books on bamboo silk."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscriptions from "聿" from "者", "者" is a sound symbol, the word "者" or in the form of simple province, "聿" is like holding a pen, and the word " shu " is from "聿", the original meaning It is writing.
humanum_full_description:
金文表示文書，頌鼎：「尹氏受(授)王令(命)書」。又用作人名，欒書缶：「䜌(欒)書之子孫，萬世是寶。」

　　《說文》：「書，箸也。从聿者聲。」段玉裁注：「箸於竹帛謂之書。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「聿」從「者」，「者」是聲符，「者」字或作簡省之形，「聿」象手持筆之形，「書」字從「聿」，本義是書寫。

①成本的著作：書籍。書刊。書稿。書香。書卷氣(指在說話、作文、寫字、畫畫等方面表現出來的讀書人的風格)。書生氣(指讀書人脫離實際的習氣)。
②信：書信。書札。書簡。書函。
③文件：證書。說明書。
④寫字或寫的字：書法。書寫。書桌。書案。書畫。
⑤寫文章：大書特書。罄竹難書。
⑥字體：草書。隸書。楷書。
⑦古書名，《尚書》的簡稱(亦稱“書經”)。
⑧某些曲藝形式的通稱：說書。聽書。

書字的基本解释

書
shū
见“书”。

書字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shū］
［《廣韻》傷魚切，平魚，書。］
“书1”的繁体字。
(1)书写；记录，记载。
(2)字，文字。
(3)字体；字形。
(4)指六艺中的六书之学。
(5)书法。
(6)指书法作品。
(7)书籍；装订成册的著作。
(8)特指某一种专著，如占兆书、历书等。
(9)指盟辞。
(10)文书，文件。
(11)文体名。用以铺叙国家典章制度。
(12)文体名。用以陈述对政事的见解、意见。
(13)指书信。
(14)某些曲艺的通称。
(15)指《尚书》。
(16)姓。明有书永琇。见《万姓统谱·鱼韵》。

書字的康熙字典解释

【辰集上】【曰字部】　書； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页502第12
【廣韻】傷魚切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】商居切，?音舒。【說文】作?，著也。从聿从者。隷省作書。【易·繫辭】上古結繩而治，後世聖人易之以書契。【註】書契，所以決斷萬事也。【周禮·地官·大司徒】六藝：禮、樂、射、御、書、數。【註】書，六書之品。又【地官·保氏】乃敎之六藝，五曰六書。【註】六書：象形、會意、轉注、處事、假借、諧聲。【許愼·說文序】黃帝之史倉頡初造書契，依類象形，故謂之文，其後形聲相益，卽謂之字。著於竹帛謂之書。書者，如也。　又書有六體。【前漢·藝文志】六體者，古文、奇字、篆書、隷書、繆篆、蟲書。又【說文】書有八體：一曰大篆，二曰小篆，三曰刻符，四曰蟲書，五曰摹印，六曰署書，七曰殳書，八曰隷書。　又【尙書序疏】諸經史因物立名，物有本形，形從事著，聖賢闡敎，事顯於言，言愜羣心，書而示法，旣書有法，因號曰書。故百氏六經總曰書也。【史記·禮書註】書者，五經六籍總名也。【釋名】書，庶也。紀庶物也。　又【詩·小雅】畏此?書。【傳】?書，戒命也。【疏

book
Basic explanation of words
book
shū
See "Book".
book
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shū］
["Guangyun" cut fish, flat fish, book. ]
Traditional characters of "书1".
(1) Writing; recording, recording.
(2) Words, words.
(3) Font; glyph.
(4) Refers to the study of the six books in the six arts.
(5) Calligraphy.
(6) Refers to calligraphy works.
(7) Books; books bound into volumes.
(8) Specifically refers to a certain kind of monograph, such as zhaoshu, almanac, etc.
(9) Refers to the alliance speech.
(10) Documents, documents.
(11) The name of the style. Used to narrate the national ordinance system.
(12) The name of the style. Used to state opinions and opinions on political affairs.
(13) Refers to letters.
(14) A general term for certain folk arts.
(15) Refers to "Shangshu".
(16) Last name. There is a book called Yongxuan in the Ming Dynasty. See "Wan Xing Tong Pu·Fish Rhyme".
book
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji 1] [Yue Zi Department] 　 Shu; Kangxi Strokes: 10; Page Number: Page 502 No. 12
[Guang Yun] Cut the fish and cut it [Ji Yun] [Rhyme] [Zheng Yun] Cut the business and residence,? Yin Shu. [Said the text] For?, the work is also. Followers. Authorized by the province. 【Yi·Cici】In ancient times, the rope was governed by a knot, and the later sages made a contract with the book. [Note] Book deeds, so you can decide everything. 【Zhou Li·Di Guan·Da Situ】Six arts: ritual, music, shooting, imperial, book, and number. [Note] Book, the product of six books. Also【Diguan·Bao Shi】is the six arts of education, and the five is the six books. [Note] Six books: pictogram, knowing, re-annotation, dealing with affairs, phony, humorous sound. [Xu Ming·Said Wen Preface] The Yellow Emperor's History Cangjie first made a book contract, according to the type of pictogram, so it is called the text, and then the phonetic and sound are mutually beneficial. Written on the bamboo silk called the book. Books, such as.　The book has six bodies. 【Pre-Han·Art and Literature History】Six-body, ancient Chinese, strange characters, seal script, official script, Miao seal, insect script. Also 【Said Wen】The book has eight bodies: one is the big seal, the second is the small seal, the third is the engraved symbol, the fourth is the insect script, the fifth is the copy seal, the sixth is the official script, the seventh is the pan script, and the eight is the official script. Also [Shushu preface] The history of the Scriptures is named by things, things have their original form, the form is engaged in, the sages interpret and teach, the things are revealed in the words, the words are comfortable with the heart, the book shows the law, the book has the law, and the number Said book. Therefore, the six classics of Baishi are also called books. 【Historical Records·Notes to the Book of Rites】Bookers, the general name of the Five Classics and Six Books. 【Release name】Book, Shu Ye. Ji Shuwu also.　[Poetry·Xiaoya] Afraid of this? Book. [Biography] Book, commandment also. 【sparse

書

Значения

Писать; бумаги, книги

Мнемоника

  • Рука с кистью или стилетом 聿, наносящая письмена 二. Писать при свете дня 日. По иной версии — фиксировать на письме то, что сказал рот с языком.

  • "Я пишу кистью иероглиф 'солнце' 日."

Варианты

书

Radicals: 聿, 日  (brush, sun)
Meaning Mnemonic
Why would you try to take a brush to the sun? It's almost too obvious, because you want to write something down.
Just imagine yourself sitting on the sun, writing back to your friends and family with a brush. For someone who can visit the sun, it's really weird that you are writing with a brush like this, but you're doing it just the same.
Reading Mnemonic
What did you write about? You were writing about this amazing circus show (しょ)you just watched on the sun. You didn't expect there to be any shows here, but turns out you were wrong!
Think of your favorite live shows and imagine them on the sun. Also imagine yourself writing back to your friends and family about said shows.

日 (день), 聿 (кисть)
